head.title: Small Field, Long Race: It's the Belmont

hedline.hl1: Small Field, Long Race: It's the Belmont

block.p: There will be six colts and one filly in Saturday's 139th running of the Belmont Stakes, and it's the filly, the highly rated Rags to Riches, who will be providing much of the intrigue as the 3-1 third choice. New York Racing Association oddsmaker Eric Donovan set the morning-line odds for the race; Joe Drape lists the horses in order of preference and provided the comments.
PURSE: $1 million guaranteed DISTANCE: 1 1/2 miles TRACK RECORD: 2:24 (Secretariat, 1973) POST TIME: 6:33 P.M. Eastern WEIGHT: 126 pounds* TELEVISION: ABC, 5-7 P.M.
*All horses carry 126 pounds, except Rags to Riches, who carries 121.

POST: 6 HORSE: Hard Spun TRAINER: Larry Jones JOCKEY: Garrett Gomez ODDS: 5-2 The runner-up in the Derby and the third-place finisher in the Preakness, Hard Spun finally gets to set the moderate pace he wants and will gallop away from this field.

POST: 3 HORSE: Curlin TRAINER: Steve Asmussen JOCKEY: Robby Albarado ODDS: 6-5 The Preakness champ is ultratalented, but he has done a lot in very little time and it will catch up to him in the last quarter of a mile.

POST: 7 HORSE: Rags to Riches TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez ODDS: 3-1 This filly is trying to do what only 2 of 21 others have done in the history of this race, which is to beat the boys. But Hard Spun and Curlin are too good.

POST: 5 HORSE: Slew's Tizzy TRAINER: Greg Fox JOCKEY: Rafael Bejarano ODDS: 20-1 Victories in the Lone Star Derby, and Lexington Stakes suggest he is improving, but this race is simply too long for this colt.
POST: 2 HORSE: Tiago TRAINER: John Shirreffs JOCKEY: Mike Smith ODDS: 10-1 He finished seventh in the Derby, and will be flying late here -- but not fast enough to make a difference.
POST: 1 HORSE: Imawildandcrazyguy TRAINER: Bill Kaplan JOCKEY: Mark Guidry ODDS: 20-1 The Derby's fourth-place finisher will also come from the clouds. And again it will not matter.
POST: 4 HORSE: C P West TRAINER: Nick Zito JOCKEY: Edgar Prado ODDS: 12-1 He has won once in six attempts, and is not bred at all for this grueling marathon.
